biolockj.util

Class ModuleUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • biolockj.util.ModuleUtil

  • public class ModuleUtil
extends Object
    This utility holds general methods useful for BioModule interaction and management.

    • Method Summary

      • getClassifier

        public static ClassifierModule getClassifier(BioModule module,
                                             boolean checkAhead)
                                      throws Exception
        Get a classifier module
        Use checkAhead parameter to determine if we look forward or backwards starting from the given module.
        Parameters:
        module - Calling BioModule
        checkAhead - Boolean TRUE to check for NEXT, set FALSE to check BEHIND
        Returns:
        BioModule
        Throws:
        Exception - if errors occur

      • getModule

        public static BioModule getModule(BioModule module,
                                  String className,
                                  boolean checkAhead)
                           throws Exception
        Get a module with given className unless a classifier module is found 1st.
        Use checkAhead parameter to determine if we look forward or backwards starting from the given module.
        Parameters:
        module - Calling BioModule
        className - Target BioModule class name
        checkAhead - Boolean TRUE to check for NEXT, set FALSE to check BEHIND
        Returns:
        BioModule
        Throws:
        Exception - if errors occur

      • getModule

        public static BioModule getModule(String className)
                           throws Exception
        Construct a BioModule based on its className.
        Parameters:
        className - BioModule class name
        Returns:
        BioModule module
        Throws:
        Exception - if errors occur

      • getModules

        public static List<BioModule> getModules(BioModule module,
                                         Boolean checkAhead)
                                  throws Exception
        Return pipeline modules after the given module if checkAhead = TRUE
        Otherwise return pipeline modules before the given module.
        If returning the prior modules, return the pipeline modules in reverse order, so the 1st item in the list is the module immediately preceding the given module.
        Parameters:
        module - Reference BioModule
        checkAhead - Set TRUE to return modules after the given reference module
        Returns:
        List of BioModules before/after the current module, as determined by checkAhead parameter
        Throws:
        Exception - if errors occur

      • getNextModule

        public static BioModule getNextModule(BioModule module)
                               throws Exception
        BioModules are run in the order configured.
        Return the module configured to run after the given module.
        Parameters:
        module - BioModule
        Returns:
        Next BioModule
        Throws:
        Exception - if input module not found in the pipeline

      • getPreviousModule

        public static BioModule getPreviousModule(BioModule module)
                                   throws Exception
        BioModules are run in the order configured.
        Return the module configured to run before the given module.
        Parameters:
        module - BioModule
        Returns:
        Previous BioModule
        Throws:
        Exception - if input module not found in the pipeline

        public static boolean isFirstRModule(BioModule module)
                              throws Exception
        Test if module is the first R_Module configured in the pipeline.
        Parameters:
        module - BioModule to test
        Returns:
        TRUE if module is 1st R_Module in this branch

        Return TRUE if bioModule started execution but is not complete.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        TRUE if bioModule started execution but is not complete

      • isMetadataModule

        public static boolean isMetadataModule(BioModule module)
        Method determines if the given module is a metadata-module (which does not use/modify sequence data.
        Parameters:
        module - BioModule in question
        Returns:
        TRUE if module produced exactly 1 file (metadata file)

      • markComplete

        public static void markComplete(BioModule module)
                         throws Exception
        Method creates a file named "biolockjComplete" in bioModule root directory to document bioModule has completed successfully. Also clean up by removing file "biolockjStarted".
        Parameters:
        module - BioModule
        Throws:
        Exception - if unable to create "biolockjComplete" file

      • markStarted

        public static void markStarted(BioModule module)
                        throws Exception
        Method creates a file named "biolockjStarted" in bioModule root directory to document bioModule has completed successfully. Also sets the start time and caches module name to list of executed modules so we can check later if it ran during this pipeline execution (as opposed to a previous failed run).
        Parameters:
        module - module
        Throws:
        Exception - if unable to create "biolockjStarted" file

      • moduleExists

        public static boolean moduleExists(String className)
                            throws Exception
        Check if a module was in the pipeline at least once.
        Parameters:
        className - module simple name
        Returns:
        boolean
        Throws:
        Exception - if runtime errors occur

      • requireSubDir

        public static File requireSubDir(BioModule bioModule,
                                 String subDirName)
        Get BioModule subdirectory File object with given name. If directory doesn't exist, create it.
        Parameters:
        bioModule - BioModule
        subDirName - BioModule sub-directory name
        Returns:
        BioModule sub-directory File object

      • subDirExists

        public static boolean subDirExists(BioModule bioModule,
                                   String subDirName)
        Return TRUE if BioModule sub-directory exists
        Parameters:
        bioModule - BioModule
        subDirName - BioModule sub-directory name
        Returns:
        TRUE if BioModule sub-directory exists
